abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Power and District
            Heating Rehabilitation Project for Kyrgyz Republic were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory, the risk
            to development outcome was substantial, the Bank performance
            was moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: the first lesson relates to the importance of the
            timing and the right sequence in sector reform efforts.
            Though the project operation by itself focused originally
            (and correctly) on public enterprise reform of the
            vertically integrated utility of a modest sized power system
            and its commercialization, the reform agenda changed later,
            under the Consolidated Structural Adjustment Credit (CSAC)
            operation, to one focusing on sector unbundling, possible
            privatization of distribution entities, and introduction of
            possible competitive trading mechanisms. The second lesson
            relates to the need for better coordination between the
            World Bank operations and those of International Monetary
            Fund (IMF) to avoid the Bank financed projects being stalled
            as a result of IMF conditionality's relating to public
            investment programs. Such coordination, however, appears to
            have improved a great deal in the recent years. The third
            lesson relates to the process of improving the cost estimate
            methodology in respect of rehabilitation projects involving
            complicated machinery. In respect of such complicated
            rehabilitation components, it will be more practical to
            dismantle the machinery, identify the actual optimal volume
            of replacement, repair and reinforcements to be carried out
            (to restore capacity or to extend life) and prepare the cost
            estimate on the basis of such investigations and analysis.
